reviews.review_msg: Kind of intimidating.  She is a very confident speaker, but she is also very clear and makes a big effort to be sure that the whole class is following.  I would definitely take a class with her again!

Jorge really gives a clear outline of what he expects of students on their assignments. If you follow his formula you are guaranteed to get a decent mark. This class is not a lot of work given that it is a 4 credit class and overall was pretty manageable compared to my other classes. I wouldn't say I learned a lot but I would take it again!

Really holds your hand through the writing process which I appreciated. I was a science major so I needed a writing workshop like this. The books he picked were really interesting. Even if you don't agree with him politically just write as if you do and you'll get a good grade. Embrace the wokeness and you'll do great.

The MOST frustrating class I've ever had to take. You're graded on 3 assignments only: 25%, 25%, 50%. I have ABSOLUTELY no clue where I'm getting my mark. His corrections are weeks late, only gives you a few comments, then bam 50%. Why I am getting this mark? Dunno. He may as well have randomly generated a # for my grade. DO NOT TAKE WITH HIM!!!!

I didn't really learn anything from this class aside from how to regurgitate the information he gave us (which was really repetitive and not valuable IMO). It seems like a lot of his courses are about the same thing (constructivism, social constructs, etc). If you've taken his class before you've taken them all. Not sure if it's a good or bad thing

Had a very narrow focus, which caused him to barely cover anything in 3 hours. Very slow marker- did not return anything until the second-last week of the course. Pay attention to your final grade and keep everything he hands back; a lot of people were not given the grades they earned (no +/-). He will (reluctantly) change it, but it is a hassle.

This course was awful. We discussed random topics about sexuality and watched movies about sex. He asked awkward questions that I didn't feel comfortable answering in font of a class full of strangers. Never taking a course with him again.

With less than two weeks left in the semester we had yet to get any marks back. No idea how we are doing in the class. No clear marking criteria. Given only 2 weeks for our final research paper that is worth 50% of our grade. We were required to buy 5 books for the class and barely used them. Incredibly frustrating class I regret taking.

This is my second time taking Gaelle's class and the instructions, lectures and everything were still just as confusing. I have taken a class with her before so I was prepared for it, but it was clear that those taking her for the first time struggled. She started becoming passive-aggressive in-person and in her emails this term which is new.
Criteria is always very vague and seems to grade very subjectively. Would not recommend

She can be a hard marker (always check your grammar). She's a little disorganized; she didn't give us the dates for the assignments and exams or their percentage worth. Definitely attend the lectures and participate, she'll appreciate the effort and you'll get a better grade. Not a lot of time provided for the exams so prepare in advance.

Gaelle is a nice person, but does not have great teaching skills. She is often unclear regarding assignment criteria and is not very helpful if you see her outside of class. Her marking is inconsistent and we didn't cover much material over the course of 3 months.

Found that for more than one assignment or test, you went in having an idea of what she wanted, and then came out with feedback from her that made you think, well you didn't say that's what you wanted..
Third course with her.  My favourite prof at SFU.

She was so disorganized that it was painful. During drop- in office hours, she makes several appointments with other students, therefore, not having any time for anyone else. What is the point of drop-in hours if you are all booked up?! I will never take another course with her.

This professor may sometimes give more information than required and this could confuse students a little... However, her passion for the subject is way up high!  She is ever so willing to go out of her way to help those that wish to succeed and she is just too adorable!  One of my best profs ever!!!
Very ambiguous and unclear.  She didn't even give us criteria for the project that is worth 50% of our grade... =(

She is confusing as heck. The articles that she chooses to bring to class are equally as confusing.  I would avoid having this woman if at all possible. In terms of giving help, she is useless, she doesn't really do much in terms of providing guidance.  She just expects you to figure everything out.
